Let me say I am an Atheist and despise being "preached" to, however at no point did I feel this was being done in the movie to try and change MY feelings on religion.
This IS however an amazing and thought provoking movie. Based on a true story of a "preacher" trying to build an orphanage in war-torn Africa, but who goes about it in a very un-Christian manner....with an army!
Brilliantly written, directed and acted, this is a very well made movie, and massively engaging.
To address the other comments here, both hatefilled and dismissive (yes there are religious speeches in it but very short and as a theatrical device to show his anger with his "flock"), and glowing and uncritical (I wouldn't trust opinions that seem biased either way). A true work of art should neither confirm or deny peoples BELIEFS, only seek to show how they effect the characters and the world around them.
SEE IT- if you like good movies!
AVOID IT- if you have an unhealthy aversion to religion lol ;)
